title: ‘Home’ by Rhye Review: For Love and All Things Holy
sub_head: The latest from Canadian producer Mike Milosh features the Danish National Girls’ Choir, imbuing his sleek electro-pop about seduction and heartbreak with liturgical overtones.
body: Late in 2012, a new musical entity called Rhye released two intriguing songs, “Open” and “The Fall,” with a disorienting lack of context. In terms of emerging acts, the early years of the 2010s were rich with authorial mystery—artists like the Weeknd, the R&B project from Abel Tesfaye, often had several widely shared songs before anyone knew who was behind them.
